meanings.definition: Come into or be in contact with (something)
meanings.sent1: I gently touch the soft petals of the flower.
meanings.sent2: Please do not touch the hot stove.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten loves to touch everything with its paws.
meanings.sent4: Her words touched my heart deeply.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays gently touch the surface of the water.

meanings.definition: A physical sensation or contact with something
meanings.sent1: The gentle touch of the breeze on my skin felt refreshing.
meanings.sent2: His touch was warm and comforting.
meanings.sent3: The touch of the ice cream on his tongue made him smile.
meanings.sent4: Her touch was like a soothing balm to his soul.
meanings.sent5: The touch of the velvet fabric was luxurious against her fingertips.

meanings.sent1: She added a touch of cinnamon to the recipe.
meanings.sent2: A touch of humor can make any situation better.
meanings.sent3: The painting needed a touch of blue to complete it.
meanings.sent4: His speech had a touch of sarcasm that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent5: The dish was perfect, just needed a touch of salt to enhance the flavor.
